Riddle-game was an ancient game of the Hobbits
column2: used as a means of settling disputes.Robert Fosters The Complete Guide to Middle-earth says that the game was used throughout Middle-earth
column3: although the narrative is not clear on that matter. The players continued to ask each other riddles until one failed to provide a correct answer.

column1: The origins of the game are not known
column2: save that it was very ancient and its rules were agreed by the Authorities and respected as sacred.Foster interprets this by saying that the rules "were held among the guardianship of the Valar"

column1: The most famous riddle-game was the one in which Bilbo Baggins and Gollum competed. If Gollum failed to answer a riddle
column2: he would show Bilbo out of the Misty Mountains. However
column4: Gollum would eat him. The two exchanged several riddles
column5: and Gollums knowledge of the answers suggested to Gandalf years later that he had possibly been a hobbit once. At last
column6: strapped for riddles to ask the loathsome creature
column8: touching The One Ring he had found in the tunnels
column9: asked "What have I got in my pocket?". Gollum failed to answer correctly
column10: despite being given three guesses. Reneging on his promise
column11: Gollum plotted to use his "Precious" to murder and eat Bilbo
column12: but when he found it missing
column13: he too late guessed the right answer to Bilbos "riddle".
